title: Equilibrium - block suspended by two strings

content.question: A block of weight <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math> is suspended by two strings of negligible mass, as shown in the figure. The strings are also attached to vertical supports. The tensions in String <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and String <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly describes the magnitudes of the forces exerted on the block, and provides correct reasoning?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> must be the largest because its horizontal component has a magnitude of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and its vertical component has a magnitude of <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>.

<math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> must be the largest because the magnitude of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> must be less than <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>.

<math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> must be the largest because it needs to provide an opposing force to both <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>.

<math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> must be the largest because the magnitude of <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is less than <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> must be the largest because its horizontal component has a magnitude of <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and its vertical component has a magnitude of <math alttext="F sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></math>.
